investigation.title: Plants grown in Apollo lunar regolith present stress-associated transcriptomes that inform prospects for lunar exploration
investigation.description: The extent to which plants can enhance human life support on other worlds depends on the ability of plants to thrive in extraterrestrial environments using in situ resources. Using samples from Apollo 11, 12 and 17, we show that the terrestrial plant Arabidopsis thaliana germinates and grows in diverse lunar regoliths.

project.title: Plants grow in lunar regolith (thale cress)
project.funding: Funding for this work included National Aeronautics and Space Administration grant NNX14AT24G (A-LP, RJF), University of Florida Office of Research - Retuned IDC (A-LP, RJF), and National Aeronautics and Space Administration grant 80NSSC19K0752 (SME).

publications.title: Plants grown in Apollo lunar regolith present stress-associated transcriptomes that inform prospects for lunar exploration
publications.summary: Plants grown in Apollo lunar regolith present stress-associated transcriptomes that inform prospects for lunar exploration â€” 10.1038/s42003-022-03334-8

characteristics.Seed Source: Arabidopsis Biological Resource Center TAIR CS70000

parameters.Growth Medium: JSC-1A Lunar simulant and Rockwool plug moistened with a nutrient solution of 0.125x strength Murashige and Skoog nutrient solution, pH 5.7
parameters.Number of seeds sown per well: 2-4 seeds per well. The seedlings thinned to 1 on day 6 or 8
